Interface SpellCheckerManagerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SpellCheckerManager

    public interface SpellCheckerManagerInterface
    This interface specifies public methods for the SpellCheckerManager class. This class uses a binary search tree to hold the words of a dictionary
    Author:
    Professor Alexander, modified by Professor Myers

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addWord(java.lang.String wordToAdd)
      The addWord method adds its argument to a dictionary of words.
      boolean checkWord(java.lang.String wordToCheck)
      The checkWord method attempts to find its argument in a dictionary of words.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> checkWords(java.lang.String wordsToCheck)
      The checkWords method attempts to find all the words in the string in a dictionary of words
      java.lang.String listDictionary()
      the listDictionary method creates a String with the words in the current dictionary to the console in alphabetic order, one word per line
      boolean readBinaryFile(java.io.File input)
      Reads from a binary file and populates the binary search tree Must use the writeBinaryFile for this file before calling readBinaryFile for this file
      boolean readDictionary(java.io.File input)
      Reads from a file and populates the binary search tree Must determine if it is a text file or binary file.
      boolean readTextFile(java.io.File input)
      Reads from a text file and populates the binary search tree
      boolean writeBinaryFile(java.io.File output)
      Stores the dictionary in a binary format
      boolean writeDictionary(java.io.File input)
      Writes binary search tree to a file Must determine if it is a text file or binary file.
      boolean writeTextFile(java.io.File output)
      Stores the binary search tree in text format, alphabetically

    • Method Detail

      • checkWord

        boolean checkWord(java.lang.String wordToCheck)
           throws InvalidSpellingException
        The checkWord method attempts to find its argument in a dictionary of words.
        Parameters:
        wordToCheck - a String
        Returns:
        true if the argument is found, false otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidSpellingException - if any of the words contain invalid characters

      • checkWords

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> checkWords(java.lang.String wordsToCheck)
                                          throws InvalidSpellingException
        The checkWords method attempts to find all the words in the string in a dictionary of words
        Parameters:
        wordsToCheck - a String of words to be checked
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Strings of words not found in the dictionary of words, null if all words in dictionary
        Throws:
        InvalidSpellingException - if any of the words contain invalid characters

      • addWord

        void addWord(java.lang.String wordToAdd)
      throws DuplicateWordException,
             InvalidSpellingException
        The addWord method adds its argument to a dictionary of words. Presumably the user has spell-checked the argument and found it missing from the dictionary, and wants to include it in the dictionary.
        Parameters:
        wordToAdd - the word to add to the dictionary
        Throws:
        InvalidSpellingException - if the word contain invalid characters
        DuplicateWordException - if the word is already in the dictionary

      • readDictionary

        boolean readDictionary(java.io.File input)
                throws DuplicateWordException,
                       InvalidSpellingException
        Reads from a file and populates the binary search tree Must determine if it is a text file or binary file. We will use a very trivial determination - if the file ends in .bin it is a binary file, if it ends in .txt it is a text file. Use the private getExtension method
        Parameters:
        input - the file to read from
        Returns:
        true if successful read, false if file could not be read from
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file is not found or accessible
        InvalidSpellingException - if any of the words contain invalid characters
        DuplicateWordException - if of the words is already in the dictionary

      • writeDictionary

        boolean writeDictionary(java.io.File input)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Writes binary search tree to a file Must determine if it is a text file or binary file. We will use a very trivial determination - if the file ends in .bin it is a binary file, if it ends in .txt it is a text file. Use the private getExtension method
        Parameters:
        output - the file to write to
        Returns:
        true if successful write, false if file could not be written to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file is not found or accessible

      • listDictionary

        java.lang.String listDictionary()
        the listDictionary method creates a String with the words in the current dictionary to the console in alphabetic order, one word per line
        Returns:
        a String that lists all the words in the dictionary in alphabetic order

      • writeTextFile

        boolean writeTextFile(java.io.File output)
        Stores the binary search tree in text format, alphabetically
        Parameters:
        output - the file to write to
        Returns:
        true if successful write, false if file could not be written to

      • readTextFile

        boolean readTextFile(java.io.File input)
              throws DuplicateWordException,
                     InvalidSpellingException
        Reads from a text file and populates the binary search tree
        Parameters:
        input - the file to read from
        Returns:
        true if successful read, false if file could not be read from
        Throws:
        InvalidSpellingException - if any of the words contain invalid characters
        DuplicateWordException - if of the words is already in the dictionary

      • writeBinaryFile

        boolean writeBinaryFile(java.io.File output)
        Stores the dictionary in a binary format
        Parameters:
        output - the location on the hard drive to store binary file
        Returns:
        true if successful write, false if file could not be written to

      • readBinaryFile

        boolean readBinaryFile(java.io.File input)
                throws DuplicateWordException,
                       InvalidSpellingException
        Reads from a binary file and populates the binary search tree Must use the writeBinaryFile for this file before calling readBinaryFile for this file
        Parameters:
        input - the File to be read from
        Returns:
        true if successful read, false if file could not be read from
        Throws:
        InvalidSpellingException - if any of the words contain invalid characters
        DuplicateWordException - if of the words is already in the dictionary
